news.title: Scores of UK parliamentarians join call to regulate most powerful AI systems
news.summary: More than 100 UK parliamentarians are calling on the government to introduce binding regulations on the most powerful AI systems. Concern grows that ministers are moving too slowly to create safeguards in the face of lobbying from the technology industry.

news.title: Is AI a bubble that’s about to pop? – podcast
news.summary: There have been fears that artificial intelligence is a bubble and that it is about to burst. Seven companies make up one-third of the value of the S&P 500. All are heavily invested in AI.

news.title: ‘Kids can’t buy them anywhere’: how Pokémon cards became a stock market for millennials
news.summary: The resale market for Pokémon cards has climbed so high that even new cards are valued at hundreds, before they’ve even been released. When a pack of cards retails at about £4, there’s a huge potential profit to be had.
